document.title: Illinois Learning Standards for Social Science 9-12

DD6B45167FFD44A38C3C3059C97BA2ED.description: Analyze the impact of stratification and inequality on groups and the individuals within them

B43AE4B32A734DE280C35EC607A6A33D.description: Explain the social construction of self and groups and their impact on the life chances of individuals

D26FCCC3665A4EFDA8359E104C146E46.description: Describe the impact of social relationships on the self, groups, and socialization processes

1F53675B02B5487CBEDF0750C2EBF857.description: Hypothesize how primary agents of socialization influence the individual

02C0C125602F4A799C01A52AAD9E8DDA.description: Analyze the impact of social structure, including culture, institutions, and societies

CC6BF0EC668C4D7A8D27B78BE22006C3.description: Identify and apply the sociological perspective and a variety of sociological theories

B0EAD1C5021E41ED910B3A47CFE4A60A.description: Use appropriate psychological terminology with reference to psychologists, their experiments, and theories in order to explain the possible causes of and impact on behavior and mental processes

0E5CC7D6CE844E2C813E8E41D80BF149.description: Apply psychological knowledge to their daily lives

EE7AC2D2A7534048B5181E9C7858140A.description: Identify and apply psychological thinking to personal and societal experiences and issues

AD6514FEBD914137A38573B005A27E32.description: Evaluate the complexities of human thought and behavior, as well as the factors related to the individual differences among people

993BD537085F4F09B42B226C24EF1BF5.description: Analyze how biological, psychological, and sociocultural factors and their interactions influence individuals' behavior and mental processes

8BB50DB1265C4FCEB4B9DE375469F082.description: Understand a variety of psychological perspectives and apply their concepts and theoretical ideas to the investigation of similarities and differences in behavior and mental processes

4F49C3BCB05F4FF1A29C4ABE24D6DD14.description: Evaluate the conclusions made by psychological research, including ethical concerns

458E33E96095467DA0A1E0164B9CEAF4.description: Identify scientific methodologies utilized in psychological research

17EB53F40B1F4F16BBB78A1882F990F7.description: Explain how local actions can have global consequences, and how global patterns and processes can affect seemingly unrelated local actions

822C2D72963C4C3CA1C9314B04295A34.description: Apply anthropological concepts and anthropological knowledge to a variety of everyday, real-world situations

64723BCBCBA8474EB9AA2246925C7E75.description: Evaluate one's own cultural assumptions using anthropological concepts

E34EBB846D0147CE89A130C0602BBCB0.description: Explain why anthropologists study culture from a holistic perspective

9EE16A3C054C41BBB3A7ED1792009FA8.description: Explain how cultures develop and vary in response to their physical and social environment, including local, national, regional, and global patterns

BC334D7AC9AA4903A2DF8F388FD80C80.description: Analyze the elements of culture and explain the factors that shape these elements differently around the world

C750CE65C601479FA66BAA567F2FE87D.description: Analyze the geographic and cultural forces that have resulted in conflict and cooperation

2F001749A9F54585B5093E2D3CBCC19A.description: Analyze multiple and complex causes and effects of events in the past

7EABF744958C4305AFB69778DC138AFB.description: Analyze the causes and effects of global conflicts and economic crises

7DC1E54A441F497F9BC9EFCD4198449C.description: Analyze the relationship between historical sources and the secondary interpretations made from them

956CBC65D6A148D2A8DEB50AB9172F4F.description: Analyze key historical events and contributions of individuals through a variety of perspectives, including those of historically underrepresented groups

1D7587E4199C4F4C9F1D189C897F4A42.description: Identify the role of individuals, groups, and institutions in people's struggle for safety, freedom, equality and justice

F68B0A4DAC304F10A58D30DBC4A7A982.description: Analyze the concept and pursuit of the American Dream

A5D07574AC004C9EA95B6BDE013A9897.description: Analyze the factors and historical context that influenced the perspectives of people during different historical eras

94E4A67D921D4C6994C7EDF699C6AD6B.description: Analyze how people and institutions have reacted to environmental, scientific, and technological changes

412097D2B0A848638AA363334BE37DBB.description: Evaluate the methods utilized by people and institutions to promote change

0DC1CEF20D424085B8CA608DC75C0A9A.description: Analyze change and continuity within and across historical eras

46EEF321E1944A0AA63EAABADAEE9A61.description: Evaluate how historical developments were shaped by time and place as well as broader historical contexts

0DFD45A5D8CC48EFB186A7CCD6829FAF.description: Analyze the costs and benefits of insurance, including the influences of an individual's characteristics and behavior

F5BF38E15957401CAE3118F485B2AEE8.description: Evaluate risks and rates of return of diversified investments

C5AC3BB0CD1F4BECB0D7F9609791BF5F.description: Analyze costs and benefits of different credit and payment options for goods and services, the role of lenders, and interest

2330DB0F2E634A048D4FDD5C5FDEA407.description: Explain how time, interest rates, and inflation influence savings patterns over a lifetime

3B795F308A0243C5BBDBBA4C5F5D787D.description: Explain how to make informed financial decisions by collecting information, planning, and budgeting

3ADBD839D7FA419DB86DB26DCA371BCE.description: Analyze the costs and benefits of various strategies to increase income

61F1E381F31740A4BD84F73F431E5CFA.description: Explain how globalization trends and policies affect social, political, and economic conditions in different nations

9A09FA4B92F14A2DA52EF4722604A735.description: Analyze the role of comparative advantage in global trade of goods and services

63B8D7E02E7D41EA80D3470EB6CA0740.description: Analyze how advances in technology and investment in capital goods and human capital affect economic growth and standards of living

F24BE37CB8EE45F286A52D5F29D2A360.description: Describe how government policies are influenced by and impact a variety of stakeholders

A5E232763ECE485BA3F00BF2499C44D1.description: Use data and economic indicators to analyze the past and current states of the economy and predict future trends

B96E74EA19FA4A769ED7ADD48E336505.description: Analyze the ways in which competition and government regulation influence what is produced and distributed in a market system

3D66B6744E014BCB88383AB4A32D0558.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of government policies to improve market outcomes, address inequality, or reduce inefficiencies

C900DC58BF8140EE8FF1BF90614C68A9.description: Evaluate how much competition exists within and among sellers and buyers in specific markets

6E3EE278535A485C8A227ED63A33FAC8.description: Use marginal benefits and marginal costs to propose a solution to an economic issue for an individual community

4B36CB1ECA47416ABD66A57C38FD44FD.description: Analyze how scarcity and incentives influence choices to consume or produce for different individuals and groups

7ADBB545154049699B56761FE2F98DE0.description: Evaluate how competition for scarce natural resources contributes to conflict and cooperation within and among countries

E9D1F53A03894B68A28248A7CF4F02F1.description: Explain how globalization impacts the cultural, political, economic, and environmental characteristics of a place or region

FD39D13FB79548E1B672590CCB6CAFC1.description: Explain how and why culture shapes worldview

B3BB4BFDEA3D490CAD85C0CD0700511A.description: Describe and explain the characteristics that constitute a particular culture

55C228AE91F7476696DFF87D91DDE3B1.description: Evaluate how short and long term climate variability impacts human migration and settlement patterns, resource use and land uses

790EB567B1324AF0940E332E8FD43D17.description: Evaluate how economic activities and political decisions impact spatial patterns within and among urban, suburban, and rural regions

8EAB29AECBFE44609EAC9A8E7D47FAB3.description: Analyze how historical events and diffusion of ideas, technologies, and cultural practices have influenced migration patterns and the distribution of human population

F3AA712C287B426EB0683374EFA0037A.description: Geographic Representations, Human Environment Interaction, Population

3334262FDFF9404BA1D329D1B21DE925.description: Analyze how human societies plan for and respond to the consequences of human-made and naturally occurring catastrophes and how these events impact trade, politics and migration

F313FB1DCCFE455381890B2FE4CC6E09.description: Evaluate how political and economic decisions have influenced cultural and environmental characteristics of various places and regions

1E361A3BBF82414086B94307C8B82A6B.description: Analyze and explain how humans impact and interact with the environment and vice versa

6746DF2191DE4998A860467AE84B676D.description: Use self-collected or pre-existing data sets to generate spatial patterns at multiple scales that can be used to conduct analysis or to take civic action

8F46D78657E944AEB65951E21F246294.description: Use maps (created using geospatial and related technologies, if possible), satellite images, and photographs to display and explain the spatial patterns of physical, cultural, political, economic and environmental characteristics

5A13FB81CB494DD49604DD68668AC89D.description: Human-Environment Interaction: Place, Regions and Culture

E673C724097F46C3AFD36BABA723C484.description: Explain the role of compromise and deliberation in the legislative process

88EEDB232E084F978712A11B4519DB20.description: Evaluate public policies in terms of intended and unintended outcomes and related consequences

5901B9C68795406C9F9E1D01A06F6548.description: Analyze how individuals use and challenge laws to address a variety of public issues

ED5D48F169B84A4899665B355C611B3B.description: Describe the concepts and principles that are inherent to American Constitutional Democracy

0191C669CBC348CFA282902AFA827585.description: Describe how political parties, the media, and public interest groups both influence and reflect social and political interests

0CF91DD19E1E4A4DB84A8A2E128C485E.description: Analyze the impact of personal interest and diverse perspectives on the application of civic dispositions, democratic principles, constitutional rights, and human rights

1F941336F08349AFA4F4921949F5DB45.description: Participation and Deliberation: Applying Civic Virtues and Democratic Principles

051D18129DCB44F18D4852DDA10E89D0.description: Explain how the US Constitution established a system of government that has powers, responsibilities, and limits that have changed over time and are still contested while promoting the common good and protecting rights

D1D789B957934EF28E62A544FA2D46E6.description: Analyze the impact of constitutions, laws, and agreements on the maintenance of order, justice, equality, and liberty

6CC1AD8772894367813AA014B96735C5.description: Evaluate the opportunities and limitations of participation in elections, voting, and electoral process

BC05BB9377ED48DF9E9B6C558FB283CE.description: Distinguish the rights, roles, powers, and responsibilities of individuals and institutions in the political system

E31D2C0C8B6E4E79B22CC8FD37532B4B.description: Use deliberative processes and apply democratic strategies and procedures to address local, regional, or global concerns

32BB3EE9D3E14BB7A534AABCBB5AF897.description: Use interdisciplinary lenses to analyze the causes and effects of and identify solutions to local, regional, or global concerns

A738604AEDA9495EA0F0EB0B36968B0C.description: Articulate explanations and arguments to a targeted audience in diverse settings

F060504A4C494633A466C6BEF83D5A03.description: Construct and evaluate explanations and arguments using sources and relevant, verified information

B91366B452D74C869F7B9CBB14E0D4D1.description: Communicating Conclusions and Taking Informed Action

395F05CC24E54C7195B678D76ADE6F6F.description: Identify evidence that draws information from multiple sources to revise or strengthen claims

575392C4BB374A3E8B2E587DAD78E7B3.description: Gather and evaluate information from multiple sources while considering the origin, credibility, point of view, authority, structure, context, and corroborative value of the sources

9B8FB1E9F3F6482181C6F91FDB6833F4.description: Develop new supporting and essential questions through investigations, collaboration, and using diverse sources

71354DACA78E46439F6465A37141D3E9.description: Explain how supporting questions contribute to an inquiry

EBE304004F5D457FBF7B919523D859FE.description: Address essential questions that reflect an enduring issue in the field
